title: 1965 Rickenbacker 360-12 Firego George Harrison THE BEATLES Spec
shop_name: London Vintage Guitars of Denmark Street, UK & Amsterdam, NL
description:
THE MAGIC NUMBER

The following instrument carries the same year and month of production as George Harrison's famed and fabled missing 360 12, which he used on many classic Beatles performances, including The Beatles last ever paid public concert at Candlestick Park San Francisco on 29th of August 1966. Details as follows

Rickenbacker 360 12
1965 (July)
Serial EG
Fireglo
Internally / Externally Original
Condition 8.5/10 (Normal, Light Playing Wear)
Original Silver Case

Rarity
The above instrument was produced by the Rickenbacker Guitar Company in July of 1965 which was only 3-4 weeks prior to the presentation of a Rickenbacker 360 to George Harrison in Minneapolis in August 1965 so may be  one of the magic 5 instruments that would have been shipped by Rickenbacker prior to the presentation in August 1965

History Of Presentation
At the end of this press conference on 21st August 1965, George Harrison is surprised as he was presented a Rickenbacker 360 electric 12-string guitar by B-Sharp Music, a local area guitar shop at the time. It was the second of this particular model of guitar that George was able to add to his collection. Harrison would play his new Rickenbacker on stage that evening. As George received the guitar, John Lennon smiled and joked: "That's fab, that! Where's mine?”
Comments

The above instrument is a rare and highly desired Rickenbacker model that carries the same detailed specification as one of the most famous and fabled of all missing Beatle instruments, that being George Harrison's 1965 360 12

1957 Gibson Les Paul

Gold Top (Maple Cap)

Dark Back

PAFs ( Strong , Even Output )

Original Case

Sound / Tone

Comments

model: 50s Relic Stratocaster ex John Squire THE STONE ROSES
title: Fender 50s Relic Stratocaster ex John Squire THE STONE ROSES 2000 - Black
shop_name: London Vintage Guitars of Denmark Street, UK & Amsterdam, NL
description:
THE MADCHESTER MOVEMENT

We are happy to offer the following instrument which  was owned, used by one of the most influential and iconic of all British guitars that being John Squire of the Stone Roses, details as follows 

History 

This specific instrument was purchased by John Squire/Stone Roses in 2012 and was used at there “Secret” Stone Roses re - union concert May 23 2012 at Parr Hall Warrington, to commemorate the concert John Stamped the instrument on the Rear “Warrington 23 05 12 “ can be seen in various film , video footage , please see full details of this instrument as follows:

Fender Relic Stratocaster 

1950s Reissue 

Black

Hand Stamped on Rear By John Squire “Warrington 23 5 12 “ 

Verification - The instrument comes with the following written and photographic verification 

Video Footage / Links of John Using / Playing the instrument 

Verification from John Squires Long Standing Guitar Tech 

Denmark Street Guitars COA

Comments 

This is an exceptionally important piece of “British“ Rock N Roll history that has come directly from artist and comes with full written and photographic verification
